votebox.middle.view.widget

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.view.widget.FocusableLabel
      • votebox.middle.view.widget.Button
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDrawable, IFocusable

    public class Button
extends FocusableLabel
    Buttons, like labels, are defined in the ballot layout. In addition to the functionality that a label has, a button is also focusable, so that it can be focused on and selected by the user. Buttons usually serve as navigational controls and delegate to a strategy for what to do when they are pressed. Buttons utilize the state pattern to determine which image to return for GetImage. They can exist in two states: focused and default.

    • Method Detail

      • initFromViewManager

        public void initFromViewManager(IViewManager viewManagerAdapter,
                       IBallotLookupAdapter ballotLookupAdapter,
                       IAdapter ballotAdapter,
                       IViewFactory factory,
                       IBallotVars ballotVars)
        Description copied from class: FocusableLabel
        The location on disk that the image wrappers will use to do the loading of the images depends on the uid, size, language. There is *one* special case here: if the uid is "reviewtitle", append the number of selections the ballot thinks have been made onto the uid. Therefore, if there have been 4 selections made in the ballot, the uid of this element should be interpreted as "reviewtitle4". Because we need a reference to the ballot lookup adapter in order to check the number of selections, we must insert this behavior here.
        Specified by:
        initFromViewManager in interface IDrawable
        Overrides:
        initFromViewManager in class FocusableLabel
        Parameters:
        viewManagerAdapter - The drawable can use this adapter to make calls to the view manager.
        ballotLookupAdapter - The drawable cna use this adapter to look up information in the ballot. This adapter cannot affect the ballot's state.
        ballotAdapter - Use this adapter to change the state of the ballot.
        factory - Use this to construct the new images.
        ballotVars - The path to the image file is here.

      • setStrategy

        private void setStrategy(IViewManager viewManager)
                  throws UnknownStrategyException
        Call this method to make this Button's strategy agree with what is defined in this Button's properties.
        Parameters:
        viewManager - Most of the button strategies will need to ask the ViewManager to do something in particular. Use this ViewManager reference if needed.
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - This method throws IncorrectTypeException if the strategy isn't stored as a string property.
        UnknownStrategyException - This method throws if the strategy that is set in this button's properties is unknown.

      • select

        public void select()
        Call this method when the voter has "selected" or "chosen" this button. This method will delegate to the strategy that is connected to it to determine the correct behavior.
        Specified by:
        select in interface IFocusable
        Overrides:
        select in class FocusableLabel

      • focus

        public void focus()
        Call this method when the voter has "focused on" or "moused over" this button. This method will delegate to the state instance to determine if the image that GetImage(...) returns will need to be changed.
        Specified by:
        focus in interface IFocusable
        Overrides:
        focus in class FocusableLabel
        See Also:
        IFocusable.focus()

      • unfocus

        public void unfocus()
        Call this method when the voter has shown that this button should not be focused. This method will delegate to the state instance to determine if the image that GetImage(...) returns will need to be changed.

      • getReviewImage

        public IViewImage getReviewImage()
        Description copied from interface: IDrawable
        Call this method to get the "review screen version" of any particular drawable. The review screen version of a drawable is scaled differently to fit a particular reveiw screen layout. Note that this method should be called on drawables that aren't, themselves, members of the review screen. This method should be called by behavior in said review screen drawables, in the process of determining which image represents the "currently selected drawable" of any given group.
        Specified by:
        getReviewImage in interface IDrawable
        Overrides:
        getReviewImage in class FocusableLabel
        Returns:
        This method returns the review screen version of any drawable.
        See Also:
        IDrawable.getImage()
